p: Welcome to the Documentation from Endkind
EnderCliTools is a lightweight collection of CLI utilities that make working in the terminal faster and more convenient.
EnderCliTools is a lightweight collection of CLI utilities that make working in the terminal faster and more convenient.
Pretty replacement for docker compose ps
Configuration management utility for handling application settings and preferences.
Pretty replacement for `docker ps` - displays Docker containers in a nicely formatted table
A pretty replacement for docker ps that displays Docker containers in a nicely formatted table.
The tool can be executed in three different ways:
-a, --all- Show all containers (default shows just running)
-f, --filter FILTER- Filter output based on conditions provided
-n, --last LAST- Show n last created containers (includes all states) [default: -1]
-l, --latest- Show the latest created container (includes all states)
--headers HEADERS- Determines which columns are displayed:
--add-headers ADD_HEADERS- Adds additional columns to the default columns (same options as --headers)
Pretty replacement for `docker compose ps` - displays Docker Compose services in a nicely formatted table
A pretty replacement for docker compose ps that displays Docker Compose services in a nicely formatted table.
The tool can be executed in three different ways:
-a, --all- Show all containers (default shows just running)
-f, --filter FILTER- Filter output based on conditions provided
--no-orphans- Exclude orphaned services (not declared by project)
removing- Show only containers being removed
--headers HEADERS- Determines which columns are displayed:
--add-headers ADD_HEADERS- Adds additional columns to the default columns (same options as --headers)
Configuration management for EnderCliTools - manage settings and preferences
Configuration management for EnderCliTools. This command allows you to manage settings and preferences for the various tools.
The config command can be executed in two ways:
The config command has the following subcommands:
help- Print help message or help for specific subcommand

EnderCliTools stores its configuration in a structured format that allows you to customize the behavior of various tools like dps, dcps, and others. Each tool can have its own specific settings while sharing common configuration options.
See the individual subcommand documentation for detailed usage examples and available configuration options.
Get configuration options for EnderCliTools. This command allows you to view current settings for table display and dps output.
Show the current table style and modifiers.
-a, --all- Show all available table configuration options
Show the current default headers (columns) for the dps command.
-a, --all- Show all available dps configuration options
help- Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)
See also: config set| config reset

Reset configuration options for EnderCliTools. This command allows you to restore default settings for table display and dps output. A backup of your previous configuration will be created automatically.
table- Reset table configuration to defaults
dps- Reset dps configuration to defaults
Reset the table style and modifiers to their default values.
Reset the default headers (columns) for the dps command to their default values.
Reset all configuration options to their default values.
help- Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)
See also: config set| config get
Set configuration options for EnderCliTools. This command allows you to customize table display and dps output globally.
table- Set table display presets and modifiers
dps- Set default headers for the dps command
Configure the default table style and modifiers for all EnderCliTools output.
Configure the default headers (columns) for the dps command output.
--headers HEADERS Set which columns are shown by default. Possible values: id, names, image, status, ports, command, created-at, created, size, labels, mounts
help- Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)
See also: config get| config reset
